fields.label: To use this service the evaded tax must have been owed in the UK
fields.infoText:
You can only use this service to report a failure to prevent the facilitation of UK tax evasion. 

Failure to prevent the facilitation of foreign tax evasion should be reported to the [Serious Fraud Office](https://www.sfo.gov.uk/).

You will need to sign out of this service.

fields.label: To use this service you must be authorised by the organisation
fields.infoText:
You can only use this service to self-report on behalf of an organisation if they have authorised you to do so. 

To report another organisation, or an individual taxpayer, contact the [HMRC fraud hotline](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs/contact/customs-excise-and-vat-fraud-reporting).

You will need to sign out of this service.

sections.title: Tell us how the criminal facilitation of tax evasion took place
sections.shortName: How facilitation of tax evasion took place

fields.infoText:
Summarise how the tax evasion was facilitated.  

Include any details you have about:

* who within the organisation facilitated the evasion
* the capacity in which they were acting
* how they facilitated the evasion
* what tax was evaded
* how it was discovered

fields.label: When is the facilitation of tax evasion a criminal act?
fields.infoText: For the facilitation of tax evasion to be a criminal act, a person must have deliberately and dishonestly helped another person to evade tax. This doesn’t include the accidental, ignorant or negligent facilitation of tax evasion.

sections.title: Give consent to how HMRC will use your information

fields.infoText:
Confirm that you understand and agree to the following: 

* the personal data collected from this report will be processed in accordance with data protection law, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Data Protection Act 2018

* HMRC will collect, use and share information submitted in this report in accordance with their  [Privacy Notice](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/data-protection-act-dpa-information-hm-revenue-and-customs-hold-about-you/data-protection-act-dpa-information-hm-revenue-and-customs-hold-about-you) (to view the Privacy Notice without leaving this report, right-click the link and open in a new tab or window)

* if the information submitted leads to an investigation, HMRC may share my contact details with other relevant third parties, where necessary

* HMRC may use evidence from this report in a prosecution or other court proceedings, where permitted by law
